titleStmt.title: W. R. Weber et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8750

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency James F Robinson Governor of Kentucky Your Petitioners would represent that Hugh T McCabe was in the Month of July 1862 fined the sum of seven 20/100 Dollars for a Breach of the Peace before J. G. Burns a Justice of Peace for Jessamine County and your Petitioners would most respectfully Petition your Excellency to remit said fine -- believing that it is one of those cases wherein the exercise of the power vested in you by the constitution may be beneficially exercised -- We therefore pray you to remit said fine --

W. R Weber
G, S, Shanklin
T, Woodson
Jas H McCampbell
R T Ferguson
Mowan Brown

Jessamine J. P. Ct
Fine Remitted
J F Robinson
$2 20/100 } Breach
H. T. McCabe
Iss Mar 27. 1863
